Part 1
The initial population size, N0
The growth rate, r
The carrying capacity, K
The end time for your time vector, tfinal
The timestep for your time vector,  tstep

```{r}
### create a function for population over time
###Start of Function
pop<- function(N0, r, k, tstep, tfinal){
time<- seq(from= 0, to= tfinal, by=tstep)
n_t<- k/(1+((k-N0)/N0)*exp(-r*tstep))
output<- data.frame(
    time= time,
    population= n_t
)
return(output)
}

pop()

df<- pop(
    N0=120,
    r=0.1,
    k=1000,
    tfinal=50,
    tstep= 0.1
)

### Question 2

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot)
plot_growth<- function(df){
ggplot(df, aes(x= time, y= population))+
    geom_line()+
    labs(
        x="time",
        y="pop size",
        title= "log pop growth"
    )+
        theme_minimal()
}

plot_growth(df)
```
